intro: Aeollanthus semicylindricus, commonly known as the semicylindrical spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant has a distinctive stem that is semi-cylindrical in shape, giving it its scientific name. Its leaves are alternate and typically have a rough texture. It produces small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts.
